name: Coco Reef Tobago

reviews.title: Coco Reef - Best Carribbean Hotel In Its Class
reviews.text: Having read some of the reviews on Tripadvisor, I want to share our very positive view of Coco Reef hotel and the staff. The Hotel is sited in a protected cove a short distance from Store Bay, and looks out Westward towards the Island of Trinidad. The Sunsets are just fantastic. The beach offers full sun or shade either under Palm Trees, or thatched sunshades. Swimming and / or snorkelling in the lagoon is both safe and interesting with large numbers of tropical fish constantly all around you.

reviews.title: Loved every moment of my stay would go again
reviews.text: We found our room to be very well appointed - King size bed, satelite TV, great shower in the bathroom, nice furnishings, and cleaned twice a day. There are two restaurants, a beach side restaurant serving carribean style buffet / BBQ lunch / dinner and a formal restaurant serving buffet breakfast and a la carte dinner. The food is exceptional, French style, with a different a la carte menu each day. Lastly the staff - To us, they absolutly made the holiday. There was nothing too much trouble - A friendly, happy team who's simple aim in life was to make sure you had a good time. Would we go back? - absolutely yes. Would we reccommend our friends to stay? - Without hesitation. Final comment - If you are looking for a smallish top class Carribean hotel with rustic charm - Coco Reef is the one to pick, just dont expect to lose weight on holiday!!!

reviews.title: not all its cracked up to be
reviews.text: I have to say that I disagree with all the comments I have read about this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on the 21 dec 2007 after being in the Grafton Hotel (that one was rubbish) for a few hours in the afternoon and one evening. On arrival at the Coco Reef we were told about the hotel and shown our room this was roomy and clean with a flower message on the two beds. I would agree that the shower was a bit tired but worked it was also a good size.
reviews.title: Overpriced
Tobago Coco Reef Resort Spa-- A place to avoid!
reviews.text: We were on the ground floor with a small patio overlooking the lagoon, The room was plenty big enough hey you only sleep and get changed it it after all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst the first impression of Tobago at the airport is a bit of a shock , 5 minutes later you are inside a beautiful manicured park and driving through palm trees to arrive at the reception.
reviews.title: Coco Reef Magic
Fantastic holiday
reviews.text: The first impression here is one of complete relaxation with views of the white beach and caribbean sea. The rooms are good quality and have a welcome message written in flower petals on the bed. A minus point was the welcome cocktail which was a mixed smoothie - maybe not everybodys taste. The only word regarding room selection is to ask for the one's in the centre sections as dogs barking in adjoining properties upset the otherwise relaxing holiday experience for some guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants provide excellent menus and we found the food at either, whether for lunch or dinner catered for every taste. Our preference was for lunch at the beach restaurant where the fish or steak bbq's were delicious. For dinner we alternated with Tamara's where the head chef has created a very wide selection. He also has a great sense of humour with his art, describing in the menus dishes as "mesmerized by", "influenced with", "surrounded by" etc.
reviews.title: Just read the report

likes.liked: — Tobagoans must be the friendliest people on the planet
likes.disliked: — Eric's penal exchange rate of 7.75 to the pound.Dollar rate far more attractive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every night there was superbly professional entertainment and dancing, should you feel the urge.
reviews.title: An Excellent Relaxing Holiday

likes.liked: — Location including grounds, staff, high quality service

reviews.title: What is everyone moaning about
reviews.text: The beach is magnificent, with very safe bathing, water sports for those more energetic or just wading in waist high parts of the lagoon surrounded by "nemo" and other colourful fish. Just when you feel a rum punch or fruit cocktail coming on, low and behold it arrives at your sun lounger served, if by magic, delivered by some charming staff members. In fact everyone from the lady who freshly prepares your morning egg of every variety, "morning my dear!" she says with a smile, all the staff are efficient and friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived very tired after long journey on 6th Jan, last ones in reception felt a bit like 'last choice' however very friendly staff made us extemely welcome, first impressions not great as we used Bacchanals’ restaurant first night ( not keen on buffet style) , our Deluxe room was supposed to offer sea view hard to verify when it's dark! Next morning greeted by great views out to sea thru the palm trees, oh boy was it worth the journey, early ( 6am ) walk on the very clean private beach confirmed our expectations, seeing other letters made us wary of insufficient beach capacity, but we must have been lucky as we never had any problems, same with Tamara’s food excellent, choice superb , service just what one expected from Caribbean, staff in most cases very friendly & helpful, overall a really great 11 days, one small point, it would have been just that much better to have a little more light in our room & a little less noise from the 'jet' engine style extractor fan in the bathroom..have just booked a return for 14 nights 2009, thus cannot be at all bad.
reviews.title: We just loved it

likes.liked: — Proximity to facilities, quite room apart from extractor fan!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Coco Reef Hotel over Christmas/New Year and had a fantastic holiday. Being repeat guests they make you feel very special which is one of the reasons why we keep going back. The beach is very safe for kids of all ages and also very beautiful with the best snorkelling you could possibly wish for in the private lagoon. A bonus for us is that our teenage children are not approached by unwanted locals wanting to sell their wares or offer drugs as they cannot access the beach.
reviews.title: Just love Coco Reef
terrific in tobago
reviews.text: The food is excellent with a variety each night, and the lunch bbq is also really nice. The staff are incredibly friendly. Our accomodation was fantastic, serviced twice daily (which doesn't always happen in the Caribbean). Nothing you ask for is ever a problem and any maintenance is dealt with very quickly. The island is beautiful, unspoilt so do not expect the hustle and bustle of other Caribbean Islands as this is a really tranquil place. We are already booked for Christmas 2008/09!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having just returned from the coco reef hotel tobago my wife and i just had to tell people about our fantastic time there.The hotel and staff were excellent.From our room to the food everything was delightful.As keen travellers we thought about going to tobago for a change from other caribbean islands and we were not to be disappointed it is a wonderful place with its laid back attitude and friendly local people.Unfortunatley the only thing to we found irritating was some of our fellow guests in the hotel who complained constantly about nothing this is tobago man.
reviews.title: beware of your expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: p.s. hello to rod stewart when he stays there sorry we missed you.
reviews.title: Not Luxuary but its what you make it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have visited all Caribbean islands from St Maarten down to Trinidad and Curaçao but I have never seen a hotel like Coco Reef in Tobago. Unique location in a small cove surrounded by a beautiful tropical garden, elegant architecture, comfortable and quiet rooms just a few steps away from the private beach, everything extremely clean and last but not least, a most friendly, courteous and efficient staff: all ingredients are here to make this resort a pure jewel. On arrival, as you pass the main gate, the sight is so gorgeous that you feel like arriving in paradise!
reviews.title: Magnificent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The atmosphere is rather quiet, even during Carnival and with a fully booked hotel. The evening entertainment (local singers, dancers and steel pan players) stops at 10:30 pm. This is good for rest and if one wants more lively night activity, there is some to be found in Crown Point just outside the hotel perimeter. But contrary to its big sister Trinidad, Tobago is a calm and secure island.
reviews.title: Fantastic !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At a less than ten minutes walk, the Café Coco offers good meals (especially fish) at very reasonable prices. This restaurant belongs to the Coco Reef hotel and presents the same elegant architecture and enjoyable atmosphere with excellent service. In peak time like February it allows to stay away from the crowded restaurants in the hotel.
reviews.title: A Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: The private beach of Coco Reef is protected by a sea wall which enables to swim in calm water even by rough seas: very convenient for children. Some coral is growing around the sea wall which presents an unexpected and nice marine life: good for easy snorkeling.
reviews.title: Caribbean Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How come this hotel is working so perfectly? No wonder when you observe its General Manager Mr Eric Feniet. From early morning to late evening he is omnipresent, buzzing around and checking everything, not counting his time to chat with his customers and to fulfil their wishes. His personnel is carefully selected and educated and it is obvious that he keeps a very cheerful relation with his staff people. A have never noticed such an exemplary leadership in any other hotel in the Caribbean. Together with the natural kindness of the Tobagonians the result is an unmatched nice atmosphere.
reviews.title: very pleasant but not 5 star

aka: Coco Reef Tobago Hotel Crown Point
